conclusion: Understand how position and size of shadows change with light source movement.
Key factors are direction and distance of light source from objects.
Shadow A is cast by the egg on the left, shadow is to the right of the egg.
Shadow B is cast by the apple on the top right, shadow is to the right of the apple.
Shadow C is cast by the baseball on the bottom left, shadow is to the right of the baseball.
Shadow D is cast by the microphone on the bottom right, shadow is to the right of the microphone.
If light source moves to the right, shadows will be cast to the left of the objects.
New Shadow A will be to the left of the egg.
New Shadow B will be to the left of the apple.
New Shadow C will be to the left of the baseball.
New Shadow D will be to the left of the microphone.
Size of shadows depends on distance of objects from light source.
If light source is closer, shadows will be larger; if further, shadows will be smaller.
Light source moving to the right increases distance from objects, making shadows smaller.
Shadows A, B, C, and D will move to the left and decrease in size.
